recommendations.recommendation: Intriguing deconstruction of e.g. Pinochio/idol-singer and mini mecha themes. Early episodes are mind numbing as the plot build-up is unusually long, but eventually satisfying.

Very good series. I saw this for thr first time about ten years ago and it is still one of my favorites. Don`t let the one and only review keep you from watching it. In my book it is probably worth an 8 or maybe even a 9.

anime.description: Classmates at school simply call http://anidb.net/ch16608 [Mima Tokiko] Key... as in the `key` to a strange mystery. The waif-like android-girl without emotions was left behind when her kindly old scientist `grandfather`, http://anidb.net/ch16609 [Mima Murao], passed away, without a way to learn how to smile. But a message for Key suggests a fantastic possibility... Could there be a way for her to become a real human, by winning the love of 30,000 friends?

category.name: Music
category.description: Music anime generally revolves around people concerned with music in their everyday lives. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competitions, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal. This is not unlike the Sports category.

category.name: Android
category.description: Androids are robots created to look like humans. A very famous example is Data from Star Trek, but they need not be as human-like as him.

category.name: Violence
category.description: Physical force against self or other, compelling action against one`s will on pain of being hurt.

category.name: Idol
category.description: Idols are young media personalities who are considered particularly cute and cuddly and who will, for a period ranging from several months to a few years, regularly appear in the mass media, e.g. as singers for J-pop groups, bit-part actors, TV personalities, models in photo spreads published in magazines, advertisements, etc.

category.name: Japan
category.description: Last stronghold for humanity, if Tokyo falls, it`s all over. Tokyo Tower will undoubtedly fall anyway.

category.name: Future
category.description:
Anime that fall under the future category are the ones that have a society that could have originated from ours. In most cases it should go hand to hand with sci-fi since we expect the future to consist of advanced technology, however, in the case where it`s explicitly stated in the story that the anime takes place "x years into the future", the state of technology doesn`t matter as long as it`s long into the future. The anime can be set in an alternative universe not tied with our own, as long as it has a futuristic feel to it.
This category sports quite a lot of anime, mostly stemming from SciFi, but not necessarily only from there.

category.name: Mecha
category.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk.

category.name: Romance
category.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

category.name: Asia
category.description: Asia is the world`s largest and most populous continent.

category.name: Earth
category.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun. It is a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). To its inhabitants, our planet is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. The Earth is the main setting of most fiction, but many titles are set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, and in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by invaders.

category.name: Plot Continuity
category.description:
Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer.
A single linear focused plot is highly continuous.
A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

category.name: Tragedy
category.description: Tragedy is a form of drama characterized by seriousness and dignity, usually involving a conflict between a character and some higher power, such as the law, the gods, fate, or society.

category.name: Angst
category.description:
A feeling of general discomfort and uneasiness is present due to either trivial or more serious reasons, often accompanied by depression.
Warning: may contain copious amounts of brooding and sighing.

category.name: Action
category.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

category.name: Sci-Fi
category.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

category.name: New
category.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

category.name: Nudity
category.description:
Nudity is the state of wearing no clothing and exposing the bare skin or intimate parts.
Especially gratuitous fanservice shows tend to show their characters frequently without any clothes, though often hiding genitals through the means of additions like steam.

category.name: Friendship
category.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: depressing
tag.description: The story progresses in a more and more gloomy way, extinguishing any hope for a "happy" ending. The anime is the opposite of "uplifting".

tag.name: human-android love
tag.description: There is a romance going on between a human (often male) and an android (usually female).

tag.name: ESP
tag.description: Extrasensory perception (ESP), involves reception of information not gained through the recognized physical senses but sensed with the mind.

tag.name: realistic sci-fi setting
tag.description: This anime really takes science seriously. Such works try to maintain scientific accuracy and/or ephasize on that and are often called "hard sci-fi". Viewer is to be convinced that depicted setting may be possible in theory via new techlology, political and social changes and so on. Some examples of non-realistic elements are faster-than-light travel and noisy exlosions in space. Eventually it demands knowledge of what`s real to tell real from impossible, right?

tag.name: secret organisation
tag.description: What anime is complete without some group working in the shadows? The organisation may be run by a government, large company or small group depending on their aims. Espionage, political power, world domination, scientific research... so long as the general population is oblivious to their existence they will keep striving for their usually sinister goals.

tag.name: weak female lead
tag.description: The female lead is quite weak and seems to have trouble protecting herself physically. Or she may be lacking in character, i.e. caves in to everything, does not have much of a will of her own.

tag.name: Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?
tag.description: The title of Philip K. Dick`s SF novel (movie: Blade Runner). The phrase implies a set of existential questions: Do artificial beings (e.g. Replicants, Bioroids, or other AI constructs) dream, feel, or have a soul? If memories can be implanted, what makes real memories real? By contrast — what makes humans human? What is reality? These are central themes e.g. in all of the Ghost in the Shell and Appleseed series / movies.

tag.name: not for kids
tag.description: This anime contains themes definitely NOT suitable for kids (e.g. rape, gory dismemberment, suicide, graphic sexual content, etc.).

tag.name: social commentary
tag.description: Social commentary is the act of rebelling against an individual, or a group of people by rhetorical means. This is most often done with the idea of implementing or promoting change by informing the general populace about a given problem and appealing to people’s sense of justice. (Source: Wikipedia) Since this is anime, usually, the mores of Japan and the Japanese society are scrutinised.

tag.name: some weird shit goin` on
tag.description: Scenes of this show point to insanely strange events which seem to be taking place; throughout its episodes, the show may or may not explain what is going on. Either way, many viewers will find that a succint and accurate way to describe the show is "WTF?", and the show`s explanations (or lack thereof) to the events will often be subject of heated debate.

character.name: Mima Tokiko
character.description: The grand-daughter of a prominent maker of robots, she believes that she is an android and her grand-father`s last words were that she needs 30,000 friends to become human. Her mother was a prominent priestess at a shrine, and thus she is very powerful, but this is suppressed, because she believes she is an android.

character.name: Mima Murao
character.description: Already dead at the start of the series; Key`s grandfather.

character.name: Wakagi Tomoyo
character.description: Key`s bodyguard, was once in the service.

character.name: Utsuse Miho
character.description: Utsuse Miho is an extremely popular idol singer.

character.name: Ajou Jinsaku
character.description: Head of Ajou Heavy Industries, has a fascination with machines and especially automatons.

character.name: Tamari Sen`ichi
character.description: Owner of low-budget adult video company V&A, he also acts as somewhat of a talent scout for idols.

character.name: Mima Toyoko
character.description: Key`s mother, also a powerful priestess.

character.name: Tataki Shuuichi
character.description: A huge fan of Miho Utsuse, and a friend to Key and Sakura.

character.name: Janome Ouji
character.description: The leader of a cult, he doesn`t really have any powers, but he likes his followers to believe he does. He tries to get Key to join, so that he can have some actual power. However, not an antagonist.

character.name: Tsurugi Hikaru
character.description: A prodigy of the showbiz world, Tsurugi used to coach Miho Utsuse. Later becomes involved with Key. A bit insane, but usually keeps a level head.
